headline: Safari with young children requires careful planning
summary: Safari with children under 6 is possible but requires specific accommodations. Many camps have minimum age policies (often 6-12 years) due to safety and noise concerns. Family-friendly camps exist but limit options significantly. Children under 6 may not have the patience for long game drives or understand the need for quiet observation.

assumptions.text: Many camps have minimum age requirements of 6-12 years for game drives.
Children under 6 typically lack patience for 3-4 hour game drives.
Family-friendly camps with no age restrictions exist but represent a smaller selection.

gains: Creating lifelong memories and wildlife appreciation
Family-friendly camps offer specialized kids programs
Some children are natural wildlife enthusiasts
losses: Parents may miss sightings managing children
Malaria prophylaxis is harder with young children

change_conditions: If children are 6+, most camps become accessible and game drive patience improves.
If budget allows private vehicles and family suites, logistics become much easier.
If children are exceptionally patient or wildlife-obsessed, earlier travel may work.
